Commentary:
My redesign reflects a geographic layout of the state. It's inspired by the flags of St. Louis, Kansas City, Springfield, and Jefferson City.

The white and blue Missouri River flows straight through the heart of the state
column6:
with three stars positioned below it to reflect the location of the major cities south of the river.

Using three 8-point stars creates 24 total points to signify Missouriâ€™s status as the 24th state.

The river motif is inspired by the flags of St. Louis and Jefferson City
column7: while the red and blue palette is drawn from Kansas City and Jefferson City. The 8-point stars mirror the design of the new 2022 flag of Springfield."
